page.title: 18Highway Service Station
page.content: The Highway Service Station was built in 1980 on a two and a half acre site which lies on the East side of the A1. It consists of two single storey buildings each of which is constructed in brick with a tiled roof. One building houses a combined shop and petrol filling station. The shop stocks motor vehicle accessories. The other building contains restaurant, snack bar and shop selling newspapers, magazines, tobacco and confectionery. The site has its own private access road which loops around a central grassed island planted with trees. The service area also has public telephones. Heavy Goods Vehicles are prohibited from using these services. During the course of a one hour period picked at random, a total of 66 cars, 6 light vans and four motorcycles called in.
